thread.title: Danny Dyer has NOT returned to EastEnders as he takes extended break to recover from exhaustion
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer has NOT returned to EastEnders as he takes extended break to recover from exhaustion

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Danny Dyer has NOT returned to EastEnders as he takes extended break to recover from exhaustion
text:
Danny Dyer has NOT returned to EastEnders as he takes extended break to recover from exhaustion The actor went to South Africa for a brief break from the soap Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
When Danny Dyer left EastEnders, he reassured fans that he was only taking a short break to sort himself out. 
But after reports that Danny was back on set have circulated a source exclusively told Mirror Online that Danny isn't back behind the bar of the Queen Vic just yet. 
"Danny is not back on set," a source close to the show told Mirror Online. 
"Any claims that he has returned to filming are false." Danny Dyer has not returned to EastEnders yet (Photo: Getty) 
It is unknown when the actor – who plays Mick Carter in the BBC soap – will return to the Square to resume filming. 
The news comes as his character was saved from doing time in prison by his mum Shirley. 
The barmaid falsely confessed to illegally selling alcohol in the Queen Vic saving her son from the clink. The actor is taking a break from the soap (Photo: WireImage) 
Yesterday it was revealed Danny's EastEnders castmates are reportedly planning a surprise welcome back party for him when he returns. 
Danny was in South Africa as he took a short break from playing loveable landlord Mick Carter due to exhaustion. 
And on his return, the actor will be greeted at a "low key shindig" in the Queen Vic, according to the Daily Star. 
A source told the newspaper: “They’re keen to show everyone is behind him 100% after his tough few months. Mick Carter has been going through a tough time on the soap (Photo: BBC) 
“They are planning a round of applause when he steps back behind the bar for filming for the first time." 
They added that he'll be welcomed back with open arms. 
“The cast know how important Danny is to the show’s success and don’t want it to be awkward." 
Last week viewers of the BBC soap feared Mick would be sent to prison – for selling knock-off booze out of hours – in order to explain the 39-year-old actor’s absence from the soap. Mick has been landed with his son's debt (Photo: BBC) It was feared Mick would go to prison (Photo: BBC) Read More EastEnders' Mick Carter prepares for prison stint - but will he confess all to wife Linda? 
Meanwhile, fans will also be seeing Lee Ryan on their screens very soon. 
Last month it was revealed BBC producers signed up the Blue hunk to play Walford's new bad boy, 'Woody' Woodward. 
"Woody is the best role I could have wished to play," he said. "He’s a brilliant character, and it’s clear he’s been leading a full and colourful life. I can’t wait for people to see what he’s like for themselves. 
"Everyone at EastEnders has been so welcoming. I know some of the cast already so I’m sure we’re going to have a lot of fun." 
Mirror Online has contacted Danny Dyer's representative for comment. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
